title: East Oakland: Baby shot in stroller expected to recover
content:
OAKLAND — A 1-year-old boy shot while riding in a stroller in East Oakland this week remained hospitalized Friday but was recovering, a police spokesman said.
Just after noon Thursday, the child’s father carried the baby into the Eastmont police substation on the 2600 block of 73rd Avenue and told officers his son had been shot.
The child, whose name was not released, was taken to a hospital and was in stable condition on Friday.
Police have not said how many times the boy was shot or where the wounds were located. The child was with his family, being pushed in a stroller on the street when he was struck by the gunfire.
Police spokesman Frank Bonifacio said investigators continued to interview witnesses Friday to determine whether the shooting was accidental. They were also investigating whether the boy was shot outside the police substation or outside his home on 73rd Avenue.
“This was unfortunate, and it’s going to be a long haul but thankfully the child is expected to recover,” Bonifacio said. “We do have some witnesses who have not yet spoken to investigators and we’re looking into this being an accidental discharge. We don’t think there’s any threat to that neighborhood. They (the family) were not targeted.”
As of Friday, no suspects had been arrested in connection with the shooting.
Anyone with information about the case is asked to call police at 510-238-3426.
Contact Natalie Neysa Alund at 510-293-2469. Follow her at Twitter.com/nataliealund.
